capturedMetadata.responseText:
I'm Hermes' project assistant. I can help you with status newsletters, Azure DevOps hierarchy validation, SLA violation tracking, and discovering user PR activity.

# [CICO][Hack/Build] Project Hermes - Automated ADO Reporting Assistant (Feature #5753933)

## Overview
Project Hermes automates creation of status updates and newsletters using Azure DevOps data and integrates with Microsoft Teams for ad-hoc queries and notifications. The feature (#5753933) is Active and has progressed through core engineering and LLM/tool integration; current focus is integration of notifications and SLA-driven workflows ahead of previews and GA.

---

## Execution Timelines & Milestones

| Milestone | Target Date | Status |
|-----------|-------------|--------|
| Project start | 2025-10-01 | ✓ Started (Start date set on feature #5753933) |
| Private Preview (target) | 2026-01-15 | ⟳ In Progress — target passed; verification needed (see assumption) |
| Public Preview (target) | 2026-02-15 | ◯ Upcoming |
| GA (target) | 2026-03-15 | ◯ Upcoming |
| Notifications / SLA capability (story #6028024) | (no explicit milestone date) | ⟳ In Progress (story #6028024 Active; tasks 6028027 Closed, 6028028 New) |

Status Legend:
- ✓ Completed — Closed/Resolved work items or explicit start date
- ⟳ In Progress — Active work items or targets passed but completion not explicitly tracked
- ◯ Upcoming — Future targets
- ✗ Blocked — High-risk items (none explicit)

Sources: Feature #5753933 (start/target dates, preview/GA fields), Story #6028024 and tasks #6028027, #6028028.

---

## Outcomes Since Last Newsletter
Top 3 recent, business-impacting deliveries (traceable):

• **Agent orchestration host implemented (#5754128)** — Orchestration layer and tool registration completed, enabling Hermes to execute LLM + tool flows and drive downstream features (#5898189, #5898188, #5898186).

• **LLM summarization / newsletter capability delivered (#5754135)** — Hermes can summarize a single level of a work item tree into the newsletter template and integrate work-item retrieval as a tool (#5969638, #5898208, #5898210).

• **Teams integration via M365 Agent SDK completed (#5969635)** — Hermes can send/receive messages in Teams, enabling user-facing interactions and notifications (#5969636, #5969637).

(References: #5754128, #5754135, #5969635)

---

## Current Milestone Progress

Current Focus: Implement and validate scheduled notifications and SLA-driven sign-ups so Hermes can proactively notify users of work-item update SLA violations (User Story #6028024).

Progress: 77% complete across child stories of the feature — 10 of 13 child user stories are Closed; 1 Active; 1 New; 1 Removed. Calculation: Completed = 10 closed / 13 total child stories = 76.9% (~77%). Evidence: child stories list under feature #5753933 (examples: #5754128 Closed, #5754134 Closed, #5754135 Closed, #6028024 Active, #6034604 New, #5754125 Removed).

Next steps:
- Complete task #6028028 (Implement sign-up capability for SLA notifications) — currently New.
- End-to-end validation of notification plumbing into Teams and sign-up workflows.
- Confirm Private Preview outcomes (evidence/acceptance) and prepare Public Preview plan for Feb 15 and GA for Mar 15 (#5753933).

Sources: child work items under feature #5753933 (see IDs above).

---

## Risks & Mitigation Plan

| Risk | Impact | Mitigation |
|------|--------|------------|
| Lack of explicit preview completion tracking | Medium — target dates (Private/Public) may be missed without acceptance artifacts | Capture acceptance checklists for Private Preview and Public Preview and update work items to Closed when validated (action: product owner to add acceptance comments on #5753933) |
| Scope creep from multi-project support (#6034604 is New) | Medium — additional integration points could delay previews | Treat multi-project support as a follow-up capability if blocking; prioritize core SLA/notifications for current previews; create separate sprint for #6034604 |
| Removed chat interface stories (e.g., #5754125 Removed) — possible scope reprioritization | Low/Medium — may reflect de-scoped UX work that could impact demos | Confirm scope decision and update roadmap; if UX still required, replan as follow-up increment |

Note: Root feature risk assessment explicitly marked "Risk level is low" in the feature (#5753933). No High risks flagged in child items metadata.

Sources: Feature #5753933 (Custom.RiskAssessmentComment), work items #6034604, #5754125.

---

Assumptions & Data Gaps
- Assumption: Private Preview target (2026-01-15) is an intended milestone; there is no explicit "preview completed" work item or acceptance record in the retrieved tree — verification required. (Feature #5753933)
- Some child items are in state Removed (e.g., #5754125) — I treat these as de-scoped artifacts unless product clarifies otherwise.
- Not all milestones are modelled as dedicated work items; milestone completion was inferred from child work-item states and feature-level date fields. If you track previews via release work items or tags, provide those IDs for precise status.
- Dates are taken from Azure DevOps fields on the feature and child items; inconsistent or missing target/finish dates on some tasks may affect schedule calculations (example: some tasks have target dates earlier than start dates).

If you'd like, I can:
- Produce a one-slide summary for leadership with the milestones, completion %, key blockers, and next decisions.
- Validate whether Private Preview was actually executed (search for release notes, acceptance test items, or tags) — provide additional work item or area-path scope if available.

(Primary source: Azure DevOps work-item tree retrieved for Feature #5753933 and its children — see referenced IDs above.)

capturedMetadata.responseText:
I'm Hermes' project assistant. I can help you with status newsletters, Azure DevOps hierarchy validation, SLA violation tracking, and discovering user PR activity.

# [CRM Core] HP Driver Update Initiative Newsletter

## Overview
This work item (User Story #123456) is titled "[CRM Core] HP Driver Update" and is recorded as Closed in Azure DevOps (System.State = Closed). The record contains start (2016-08-31) and target (2016-09-19) dates but no description or acceptance criteria. Based on the title, the objective appears to be delivering an HP driver update within CRM Core to restore or improve device compatibility; this is an inferred business objective and should be validated with the product owner (#118973 is listed as the parent).  

---

## Execution Timelines & Milestones

| Milestone | Target Date | Status |
|-----------|-------------|--------|
| HP Driver Update (User Story #123456) | 2016-09-19 | ✓ Completed (Closed) |

Status Legend:
- ✓ Completed (Closed/Resolved work items)
- ⟳ In Progress (Active work items)
- ◯ Upcoming (New work items)
- ✗ Blocked (work items flagged High risk)

---

## Outcomes Since Last Newsletter
• **Delivered HP driver update to CRM Core (Work Item #123456):** Item is Closed — indicates the change was completed and delivered to the tracked branch/commit history. Confirmed links include associated commits and branch artifacts (see Dev links on the work item).  
• **Test artifacts referenced:** Several test cases/shared steps reference this story (e.g., #635434, #553794, #545486, #602701) — these indicate testing activity tied to the delivery.  

Note: Business impact (e.g., reduced incidents, user adoption) is not recorded in the work item and should be confirmed with product analytics or support metrics.

---

## Current Milestone Progress

**Current Focus:** No active development — the primary user story (#123456) is Closed. Recommend focusing on validation (post-deployment monitoring and stakeholder acceptance).  

**Progress:** 100% complete for the tracked user story (1 of 1 items closed).  
**Next Steps:** 
- Validate production telemetry and support tickets to confirm the expected impact.  
- Close or reconcile any remaining test cases referenced (#635434, #553794, #545486, #602701).  
- Confirm parent feature/epic acceptance and release notes with owner of #118973.

---

## Risks & Mitigation Plan
No explicit Medium/High risk flags were present on the work item record for #123456.

- Current status: No significant risks identified at this time. Monitoring continues.
- Suggested mitigations (proactive):
  - Monitor support and telemetry for regressions for 2-4 weeks post-deployment.
  - Ensure release notes and known-issues are communicated to support and customer success.
  - Validate that dependent areas referenced by "Affects" links (e.g., #782228, #754754, #782208) report no regressions.

---

Assumptions & Data Gaps
- The supplied ID (123456) is a User Story, not a Feature — user requested a "feature" but the item type is System.WorkItemType = User Story. Parent is listed as #118973 (please confirm if that is the intended feature/epic).  
- Missing fields: work item description, acceptance criteria, owner, actual/completion date, release/release train, and business outcome metrics. These gaps limit confirmation of customer impact and deployment scope.  
- Related artifacts and test case IDs were inferred from the work item relations returned by Azure DevOps (relations include parent #118973 and test/shared-step references #635434, #553794, #545486, #602701; affects links include #782228, #754754, #782208).

Sources: Azure DevOps work item #123456 (relations: parent #118973; test refs #635434, #553794, #545486, #602701; affects #782228, #754754, #782208).  

If you want a newsletter scoped to the parent feature/epic (#118973) or a full hierarchy (depth >3) so we can report across all child features/stories, tell me which work item ID to use and I will retrieve and summarize it.
